intro: Secamone toxocarpoides var. toxocarpoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
